docs/BooseTesting.html.summary: Namespace BooseTesting Classes testing Aims to pass the requirements and test the drawto,moveto and running multiple commands at once

docs/BooseTesting.testing.html.title: Class testing | BOOSEDOC
docs/BooseTesting.testing.html.summary: Class testing Namespace BooseTesting Assembly BooseTesting.dll Aims to pass the requirements and test the drawto,moveto and running multiple commands at once [TestClass] public sealed class testing Inheritance object testing Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods AppDrawToTest() Defines new instances of moveto,appcanvas,and stored program so that i can pass a command through the process to ensure it works correctly. I pass in a string that has the parameters before calling the set and compile and executing the command by calling the canvas. An assert equals then checks the x and y position to ensure it is at the expected position based off the command just being ran is correct [TestMethod] public void AppDrawToTest() AppMoveToTest() Defines new instances of moveto,appcanvas,and stored program so that i can pass a command through the process to ensure it works correctly. I pass in a string that has the parameters before calling the set and compile and executing the command by calling the canvas. An assert equals then checks the x and y position to ensure it is at the expected position based off the command just being ran [TestMethod] public void AppMoveToTest() MoveToTest() Tests the move to command from canvas by calling it and passing in an x and y parameter and checks if they match the expected output with assert equals to confirm [TestMethod] public void MoveToTest() MultiLineTest() Runs a total of three commands one after the other to simulate a multiline program being passed in to check that it works as intended and the x and y position finishes at the expected coordinates. [TestMethod] public void MultiLineTest()

docs/JTEW_BOOSE.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | BOOSEDOC
docs/JTEW_BOOSE.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace JTEW_BOOSE Assembly JTEW-BOOSE.dll new version of the canvas class that extends the Icanvas interface so that all the relevant drawing methods can be referenced and created that exist within so they can be overidden to implement my own version public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Constructor for Appcanvas public AppCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int ysize int Fields errorY public int errorY Field Value int filled public bool filled Field Value bool Properties PenColour public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Xpos constructors for the current positioning of the pen cursor so that the drawing methods can work public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Creates a circle method that checks the the parameters before calling the graphics drawing method using the integer stored in radius public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int filled bool Exceptions InvalidOperationException Clear() Clear method clears all drawings and contents off the bitmap for a blank slate. Is called when my clear button is pressed or can be typed into the input box public void Clear() Exceptions ArgumentNullException DrawTo(int, int) A method defines to points on the bitmap so a pen line can be drawn between them so both points meet using two integers passed in as parameters from the input box of an x and y coordinate. A try exception method is first ran to ensure the parameters entered are relevant before calling the drawline method on giving x and y coordinate parameters with the current pen position and pen attributes public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int y int Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException MoveTo(int, int) using passed in x and y coordinates the pen position can move across the bitmap for different drawing methods. An exception is created so you cannot move off the set screen size before actually moving the pen cursor public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int y int Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException Rect(int, int, bool) Method for drawing the rectangle takes 3 parameters with two defined at user input and passed down so the graphic knows how large of rectangle is drawn. The rectangle is drawn at the current position of the pen. The boolean variable filled ensures the rectangles sides are drawn and all meet public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int height int filled bool Exceptions InvalidOperationException Reset() calls the moveto method to reset the pen cursor back to the starting position on the bitmap acting as a reset public void Reset() Set(int, int) Sets the canvas size but does not public void Set(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int ysize int SetColour(int, int, int) using three userinputs passed through as parameters defines the rgb drawing colour of the pen a try catch ensures the rgb integers are within 0-255 for a valid colour public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int green int blue int Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException ShowError(string) currently not implemented properly. Planned to be used for when errors are written on the bitmap so that userinputs are written with one method and errors are written with another so they can have different exceptions and attributes. The text string will be the error message eventually displayed public void ShowError(string text) Parameters text string Tri(int, int) Draws a triangle at the current pen position with passed in width and height parameters public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int height int Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException WriteText(string) Writes text onto the bitmap using the passed in string text by user commands as well as error text to display public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string getBitmap() instantiates the bitmap so it can be drawn on the form public object getBitmap() Returns object Exceptions NullReferenceException

docs/JTEW_BOOSE.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace JTEW_BOOSE Assembly JTEW-BOOSE.dll This factory extends the command factory in boose so that the relevant methods can be used such as makeCommand to make a new custom instance of each drawing method public class AppCommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory AppCommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods MakeCommand(string) Allows for the custom "app" commands to be called by passing in the string to be compared with the switchcase case by case. docs/JTEW_BOOSE.html.title: Namespace JTEW_BOOSE | BOOSEDOC
docs/JTEW_BOOSE.html.summary: Namespace JTEW_BOOSE Classes AppCanvas new version of the canvas class that extends the Icanvas interface so that all the relevant drawing methods can be referenced and created that exist within so they can be overidden to implement my own version AppCircle Inherits BOOSE.CommandOneParameter meaning that this class expects and only takes one valid parameter so that it can be passed in to draw a circle Sets up the circle command and its parameter so a circle can be drawn with canvas AppClear allows for the bitmap to cleared to a blank slate AppCommandFactory This factory extends the command factory in boose so that the relevant methods can be used such as makeCommand to make a new custom instance of each drawing method AppDrawTo Inherits BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters so that two arguements are expected to be passed in so that a line can be drawn from the x coordinate parameter to the y coordinate AppMoveTo Creates and calls the moveto command so that the pen is repositioned by the canvas passing an x and y coordinate to move the pen when it is executed. Inherits BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters meaning two parameters must be passed in for both coordinates so that they can be passed to canvas. AppPColour Sets the pen colour for drawing. Inherits from BOOSE.CommandThreeParameters so the number of parameters much match representing (RGB red,green,blue) AppRect Inherits BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters so that two arguements are expected to be passed in so that a rectangle can be drawn from the width and height at the current x and y coordinate. AppTri AppWriteText Inherits BOOSE.CommandOneParameter meaning that this class expects and only takes one valid parameter so that it can be passed to write the text onto the bitmap Sets up the circle command and its parameter so a circle can be drawn with canvas BOOSE The main class that allows for the program to run BOOSE calling relevant interfaces connecting parser, command factory, stored program and drawing canvas.
